methods.name: starknet_subscribeNewHeads
methods.description: Creates a WebSocket stream which will fire events for new block headers

params.name: block_id
params.summary: The block to get notifications from, default is latest, limited to 1024 blocks back

methods.name: starknet_subscriptionNewHeads
methods.description: Notification to the client of a new block header

methods.name: starknet_subscribeEvents
methods.description: Creates a WebSocket stream which will fire events for new Starknet events with applied filters. Events are emitted for all events from the specified block_id, up to the latest block

params.name: from_address
params.summary: Filter events by from_address which emitted the event

params.name: keys
params.summary: The keys to filter events by

params.name: block_id
params.summary: The block to get notifications from, default is latest, limited to 1024 blocks back

params.name: finality_status
params.summary: The finality status of the most recent events to include, default is ACCEPTED_ON_L2

methods.name: starknet_subscriptionEvents
methods.description: Notification to the client of a new event. The event also includes the finality status of the transaction emitting the event

methods.name: starknet_subscribeTransactionStatus
methods.description: Creates a WebSocket stream which at first fires an event with the current known transaction status, followed by events for every transaction status update

params.name: transaction_hash
params.summary: The transaction hash to fetch status updates for

methods.name: starknet_subscriptionTransactionStatus
methods.description: Notification to the client of a new transaction status

methods.name: starknet_subscribeNewTransactionReceipts
methods.description: Creates a WebSocket stream which will fire events when new transaction receipts are created. The endpoint receives a vector of finality statuses. An event is fired for each finality status update. It is possible for receipts for pre-confirmed transactions to be received multiple times, or not at all.

params.name: finality_status
params.summary: A vector of finality statuses to receive updates for, default is [ACCEPTED_ON_L2]

params.name: sender_address
params.summary: Filter transaction receipts to only include transactions sent by the specified addresses

methods.name: starknet_subscriptionNewTransactionReceipts
methods.description: Notification to the client of a new transaction receipt, with its current finality status

methods.name: starknet_subscribeNewTransactions
methods.description: Creates a WebSocket stream which will fire events when new transaction are created. The endpoint receives a vector of finality statuses. An event is fired for each finality status update. It is possible for events for pre-confirmed and candidate transactions to be received multiple times, or not at all.

params.name: finality_status
params.summary: A vector of finality statuses to receive updates for, default is [ACCEPTED_ON_L2]

params.name: sender_address
params.summary: Filter to only include transactions sent by the specified addresses

methods.name: starknet_subscriptionNewTransaction
methods.description: Notification to the client of a new transaction, with its current finality status

params.name: result
params.description: A transaction and its current finality status

methods.name: starknet_subscriptionReorg
methods.description: Notifies the subscriber of a reorganization of the chain
methods.summary: Can be received from subscribing to newHeads, Events, TransactionStatus

methods.name: starknet_unsubscribe
methods.description: Close a previously opened ws stream, with the corresponding subscription id

result.name: Unsubscription result
result.description: True if the unsubscription was successful

SUBSCRIPTION_ID.name: subscription id
SUBSCRIPTION_ID.description: An identifier for this subscription stream used to associate events with this subscription.

SUBSCRIPTION_BLOCK_ID.title: Subscription Block id
SUBSCRIPTION_BLOCK_ID.description: Block hash, number or tag, same as BLOCK_ID, but without 'pre_confirmed' or 'l1_accepted'

TXN_STATUS_WITHOUT_L1.title: Transaction status without ACCEPTED_ON_L1
TXN_STATUS_WITHOUT_L1.description: Transaction status for new transactions subscription

REORG_DATA.name: Reorg Data
REORG_DATA.description: Data about reorganized blocks, starting and ending block number and hash

starting_block_hash.title: Starting Block Hash
starting_block_hash.description: Hash of the first known block of the orphaned chain

starting_block_number.title: Starting Block Number
starting_block_number.description: Number of the first known block of the orphaned chain

ending_block_hash.title: Ending Block
ending_block_hash.description: The last known block of the orphaned chain

ending_block_number.title: Ending Block Number
ending_block_number.description: Number of the last known block of the orphaned chain

TOO_MANY_ADDRESSES_IN_FILTER.message: Too many addresses in filter sender_address filter

TOO_MANY_BLOCKS_BACK.message: Cannot go back more than 1024 blocks
